pages.title: Silk Moth
pages.text: Delicate, light-seeking insects found in $(bold)Dark Forest$() biomes. Key source of silk for early magical crafts. Fragile (≈2 hearts).

pages.title: Light Attraction
pages.text: Silk Moths are drawn to light sources (blocks tagged $(thing)attracts_moth$()), such as Lanterns, Salt Lamps, and Sea Lanterns. When no lights are nearby, they wander or perch.

pages.title: Behavior & Variants
pages.text: $(li)Seeks tagged lights; idles when none nearby.$(br)$(li)Spawns in four colors: Brown, Black, Blue, Pink.$(br)$(li)Low health—avoid incidental damage when collecting.

pages.title: Silk Fiber
pages.text: Drops $(bold)1–2$() on kill. Used across magical crafts, e.g. $(l:hexalia:content/idols)Idols$(/l) and utility items like Cobwebs.

pages.title: Capturing Moths
pages.text: Right-click a Silk Moth with a $(thing)Rustic Bottle$() to bottle it humanely. The bottle preserves the moth’s data (including custom names) for collection or transport.

pages.title: Silkworm Cocoons
pages.text: Naturally generate on $(bold)Dark Oak$() trunks in Dark Forests, or on $(bold)Cottonwood$() in Swamps. Useful for renewable silk production.

pages.title: Cocoon Interactions
pages.text: $(li)$(bold)Moth Emergence$(): Right-click a cocoon with a light-emitting block (e.g., Lantern) to coax out a Silk Moth after a short delay.$(br)$(li)$(bold)Silkworm Harvest$(): Break the cocoon to release a Silkworm; combine with Leaves to obtain $(thing)Silk Fiber$().

pages.title: Tips
pages.text: $(li)Place safe lights (Lanterns/Salt Lamps) to attract moths without burning them.$(br)$(li)Bring Rustic Bottles to collect variants.$(br)$(li)Set up farm trees (Dark Oak or Cottonwood) to spawn cocoons passively.
